leaf_cluster_name: 天文-时间域与瞬变检测生态
task_chain: 去噪→检测→分类→告警→调度

tools.name: symdim
tools.one_line_profile: Equation manipulation with dimensional analysis using SymPy and Astropy
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that integrates SymPy and Astropy.units to perform equation manipulation while maintaining and checking dimensional analysis, useful for physics and astronomy calculations.

tools.name: POTPyRI
tools.one_line_profile: Data reduction pipeline for imaging from large aperture telescopes
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based data reduction pipeline designed for processing imaging data from large aperture telescopes, facilitating the analysis of astronomical transients.

tools.name: zodipy
tools.one_line_profile: Zodiacal light simulations for astronomy
tools.detailed_description: An Astropy-affiliated package for simulating zodiacal light emission, useful for planning observations and analyzing background noise in astronomical data.

tools.name: dkist
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for processing and interacting with DKIST solar telescope data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for obtaining, processing, and interacting with calibrated data from the Daniel K. Inouye Solar Telescope (DKIST).

tools.name: pgmuvi
tools.one_line_profile: Gaussian processes for inference on multi-wavelength light curves
tools.detailed_description: A Python package implementing Gaussian processes for inference on multi-wavelength light curves, specifically designed for astronomical time-domain analysis.

tools.name: KPF-Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Data reduction pipeline for Keck Planet Finder
tools.detailed_description: The data reduction pipeline for the Keck Planet Finder (KPF) instrument, handling the processing of spectroscopic data.

tools.name: allesfitter
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible inference of stars and exoplanets from photometric and radial velocity data
tools.detailed_description: A package for fitting photometric and radial velocity data, wrapping ellc, dynesty, emcee, and celerite to model light curves and RV signals for exoplanet science.

tools.name: Everest Framework
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for HL7v3 and CDA medical data structures
tools.detailed_description: A .NET framework designed to ease the creation, formatting, and transmission of HL7v3 and Clinical Document Architecture (CDA) structures for medical informatics and healthcare data exchange.

tools.name: jeverest
tools.one_line_profile: Java framework for HL7v3 medical data structures
tools.detailed_description: The Java implementation of the Everest Framework, facilitating the handling of HL7v3 structures for medical data interoperability.

tools.name: JetFit
tools.one_line_profile: Gamma-ray Burst Afterglow Light Curve Fitting Tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for fitting Gamma-ray Burst (GRB) afterglow light curves, aiding in the analysis of transient astronomical events.

tools.name: k2sc
tools.one_line_profile: K2 systematics correction using Gaussian processes
tools.detailed_description: A tool for correcting systematics in K2 (Kepler) light curves using Gaussian processes, improving the quality of photometric data for exoplanet detection and stellar astrophysics.

tools.name: TESS_Gaia_Light_Curve
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for TESS FFI light curve fitting and decontamination
tools.detailed_description: A workflow/pipeline for fitting TESS Full Frame Image (FFI) light curves with effective PSF modeling and decontaminating them using Gaia DR3 data.

tools.name: lunarsky
tools.one_line_profile: Astropy extension for lunar surface observation geometry
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that extends Astropy to describe observations and coordinate transformations from the surface of the Moon.

tools.name: eleanor
tools.one_line_profile: TESS Full Frame Image light curve extraction pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for downloading, analyzing, and visualizing data from the TESS Full Frame Images, specifically for extracting light curves.

tools.name: MoonPy
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for exoplanet and exomoon light curve analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive toolkit for downloading, detrending, visualizing, and fitting light curves for exoplanet and exomoon research.

tools.name: ASDF
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced Scientific Data Format library
tools.detailed_description: A next-generation interchange format for scientific data, providing a Python library for reading and writing ASDF files.

tools.name: asdf-astropy
tools.one_line_profile: ASDF serialization support for Astropy objects
tools.detailed_description: An extension library that provides the necessary tags and schemas to serialize Astropy objects (like coordinates, tables, and models) into ASDF format.

tools.name: Astropy
tools.one_line_profile: Core library for Astronomy and Astrophysics
tools.detailed_description: The core package for Astronomy in Python, providing common tools such as units, coordinates, FITS handling, and modeling.

tools.name: astropy-healpix
tools.one_line_profile: HEALPix pixelization for Astropy
tools.detailed_description: A BSD-licensed implementation of HEALPix (Hierarchical Equal Area isoLatitude Pixelization) for use with Astropy.

tools.name: astroquery
tools.one_line_profile: Access to online astronomical data services
tools.detailed_description: A package for querying and retrieving data from online astronomical archives and web services (e.g., SIMBAD, VizieR, MAST).

tools.name: astrowidgets
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter widgets for astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A set of Jupyter widgets for interactive visualization and analysis of astronomical data, leveraging the Astropy ecosystem.

tools.name: ccdproc
tools.one_line_profile: Optical/IR CCD data reduction toolkit
tools.detailed_description: An Astropy affiliated package for basic data reduction of CCD images, including bias/dark subtraction and flat fielding.

tools.name: photutils
tools.one_line_profile: Source detection and photometry tools
tools.detailed_description: An Astropy package for detecting sources on astronomical images and performing photometry (aperture and PSF).

tools.name: pyregion
tools.one_line_profile: DS9 region file parser
tools.detailed_description: A Python module to parse ds9 region files and display them on images using Matplotlib.

tools.name: PyVO
tools.one_line_profile: Virtual Observatory (VO) access library
tools.detailed_description: A package providing access to remote data and services of the Virtual Observatory (VO) using Python.

tools.name: regions
tools.one_line_profile: Astropy region handling package
tools.detailed_description: An in-development package for handling regions (spatial subsets) in Astropy, including defining, plotting, and masking.

tools.name: specreduce
tools.one_line_profile: Spectroscopic reduction tools
tools.detailed_description: A package for the reduction of spectroscopic observations from Optical and NIR instruments.

tools.name: specutils
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical spectroscopy utilities
tools.detailed_description: An Astropy coordinated package for representing, analyzing, and manipulating astronomical spectra.

tools.name: taufit
tools.one_line_profile: AGN light curve modeling with Celerite
tools.detailed_description: A tool for efficient AGN light curve modeling and parameter estimation using the Celerite Gaussian Process library.

tools.name: agnpy
tools.one_line_profile: Modelling jetted Active Galactic Nuclei radiative processes
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for modelling the radiative processes of jetted Active Galactic Nuclei (AGN).

tools.name: ASPIRED
tools.one_line_profile: Automated SpectroPhotometric Image REDuction pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for the automated reduction of spectrophotometric images, designed for rapid processing.

tools.name: celerite
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable 1D Gaussian Processes
tools.detailed_description: A library for fast and scalable Gaussian Process regression in one dimension, widely used for astronomical time series analysis.

tools.name: george
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and flexible Gaussian Process regression
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for Gaussian Process regression, designed for use in astronomy and other scientific fields.

tools.name: PhotoPipe
tools.one_line_profile: Automated reduction, photometry, and astrometry pipeline for RATIR and RIMAS data
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed for the automated reduction, photometry, and astrometry of imaging data from the RATIR and RIMAS instruments, facilitating the generation of light curves.

tools.name: Nova DSO Tracker
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time tracking and observability prediction for deep-sky objects
tools.detailed_description: An application for astrophotographers and observers to track deep-sky objects' altitude in real-time, predict observability, and integrate with Stellarium and SIMBAD databases.

tools.name: reducer
tools.one_line_profile: Friendly professional-level astronomical data reduction tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to simplify the process of astronomical data reduction and calibration, providing a user-friendly interface for processing imaging data.

tools.name: radbelt
tools.one_line_profile: Astropy-friendly wrapper for the AE-8/AP-8 Van Allen belt models
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper that provides an Astropy-compatible interface to the AE-8 and AP-8 models of the Van Allen radiation belts, useful for space science and mission planning.

tools.name: LATTE
tools.one_line_profile: Lightcurve Analysis Tool for Transiting Exoplanets
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed for the visual inspection and analysis of light curves from transiting exoplanet surveys, helping to identify false positives and validate candidates.

tools.name: michael
tools.one_line_profile: Estimator for robust spot rotation rates from TESS light curves
tools.detailed_description: A Python package to estimate robust stellar spot rotation rates from TESS Full Frame Image (FFI) light curves generated by the Eleanor pipeline.

tools.name: citlalicue
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for creating and manipulating stellar light curves
tools.detailed_description: A software package designed to create and manipulate stellar light curves, likely for simulation or preprocessing purposes in exoplanet or stellar variability studies.

tools.name: exotrending
tools.one_line_profile: Fast light curve detrending software for exoplanets
tools.detailed_description: A fast and easy-to-use software tool specifically designed for detrending light curves, a critical step in exoplanet detection and characterization.

tools.name: feets
tools.one_line_profile: Feature Extractor for Time Series
tools.detailed_description: A library for extracting features from time series data, specifically designed for astronomical light curves to aid in classification and analysis.

tools.name: everest
tools.one_line_profile: EPIC Variability Extraction and Removal for Exoplanet Science Targets
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for de-trending K2 light curves, using pixel level decorrelation to remove instrumental noise and improve photometric precision.

tools.name: starry_process
tools.one_line_profile: Interpretable Gaussian processes for stellar light curves
tools.detailed_description: A library that implements interpretable Gaussian processes specifically for modeling stellar light curves, allowing for the inference of surface features.

tools.name: DELightcurveSimulation
tools.one_line_profile: Emmanoulopoulos style lightcurve simulation
tools.detailed_description: A tool for simulating light curves using the Emmanoulopoulos et al. method, useful for generating synthetic data for testing analysis pipelines.

tools.name: astrolibpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python port of IDL astrolib
tools.detailed_description: A repository of astronomical codes converted from the IDL astrolib, providing various utility functions for astronomical data analysis.

tools.name: PyFITS
tools.one_line_profile: Library for reading and writing FITS files (Legacy)
tools.detailed_description: A library for reading and writing FITS (Flexible Image Transport System) files, the standard data format in astronomy. Although deprecated in favor of Astropy, it remains a foundational tool.

tools.name: astroimtools
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical Image Convenience Tools
tools.detailed_description: A package providing convenience tools for processing and analyzing astronomical images, including cutouts and statistics.

tools.name: gwcs
tools.one_line_profile: Generalized World Coordinate System
tools.detailed_description: A library for managing Generalized World Coordinate Systems (GWCS), providing tools for mapping pixel coordinates to world coordinates in a flexible way.

tools.name: imexam
tools.one_line_profile: Image examination and plotting tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for simple image examination and plotting, offering functionality similar to the classic IRAF imexamine task.

tools.name: jwql
tools.one_line_profile: James Webb Space Telescope Quicklook Application
tools.detailed_description: A web application and tool suite for monitoring the health and data quality of the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) instruments.

tools.name: stsynphot_refactor
tools.one_line_profile: Synthetic photometry using Astropy for HST and JWST
tools.detailed_description: A package for synthetic photometry specifically tailored for HST and JWST, utilizing the Astropy framework to simulate observations.

tools.name: synphot_refactor
tools.one_line_profile: Synthetic photometry using Astropy
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose package for synthetic photometry using Astropy, allowing users to simulate photometric data from spectra and passbands.

tools.name: Optika
tools.one_line_profile: A Python library for simulating optical systems and ray tracing
tools.detailed_description: Optika is a Python library designed for simulating optical systems, offering capabilities similar to Zemax. It allows for the modeling of optical components, ray tracing, and analysis of optical performance, suitable for physics and astronomical instrumentation.

tools.name: ndcube
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-dimensional coordinate-aware array library for solar physics
tools.detailed_description: ndcube is a SunPy-affiliated package that provides a base class for handling multi-dimensional contiguous and non-contiguous coordinate-aware arrays. It is designed to handle complex scientific data cubes, particularly in solar physics, integrating data with World Coordinate System (WCS) information.

tools.name: SunPy
tools.one_line_profile: The community-developed open-source software library for solar physics
tools.detailed_description: SunPy is a comprehensive Python library for solar physics data analysis. It provides tools for querying and downloading data from solar missions, loading and visualizing images and time series, and performing coordinate transformations and physical calculations.

tools.name: sunraster
tools.one_line_profile: Tools to analyze spectral data from solar missions
tools.detailed_description: sunraster is a SunPy-affiliated package specifically designed for the analysis of spectral data (raster scans) from solar physics missions. It builds upon ndcube to provide specialized functionality for handling slit-spectrograph data.

tools.name: deepARTransit
tools.one_line_profile: LSTM-based library for interpolating and detrending transit light curves
tools.detailed_description: deepARTransit is a Python library that utilizes Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) neural networks to interpolate and detrend exoplanet transit light curves. It is designed to handle the noise and variability in photometric data to improve transit detection and characterization.

tools.name: pydl
tools.one_line_profile: Library of IDL astronomy routines converted to Python
tools.detailed_description: pydl implements Python replacements for common IDL (Interactive Data Language) routines used in astronomy. It facilitates the transition from IDL to Python for astronomers by providing familiar functionality for data processing and mathematical operations.

tools.name: fourpiskytools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for handling astronomical VOEvents for transient alerts
tools.detailed_description: A set of tools designed to help astronomers get started with sending or receiving VOEvents, which are standard packets for reporting transient astronomical events.

tools.name: Space_signal_detection_all4
tools.one_line_profile: Gravitational wave data denoising and signal detection
tools.detailed_description: A software package for denoising gravitational wave data and detecting signals, specifically targeted at space-based detection scenarios.

tools.name: Ampel-core
tools.one_line_profile: Core framework for the AMPEL astronomical alert analysis system
tools.detailed_description: The core component of AMPEL (Alice in Modular Provenance-Enabled Land), a modular and scalable platform for analyzing and processing high-throughput astronomical alert streams (e.g., from ZTF, LSST).

tools.name: Antares_Simulator
tools.one_line_profile: Open source power system simulator for energy adequacy and economic performance
tools.detailed_description: A sequential Monte-Carlo simulator designed to assess the adequacy and economic performance of interconnected power systems over short or long-term horizons.

tools.name: antares-xpansion
tools.one_line_profile: Investment simulation extension for Antares Simulator
tools.detailed_description: An extension for Antares Simulator that performs investment simulations and capacity expansion planning for power systems.

tools.name: antares_craft
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for manipulating Antares Simulator studies
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to read, edit, and manage study files and configurations for the Antares Power System Simulator.

tools.name: AstroAccelerate
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated time-domain radio astronomy data processing
tools.detailed_description: A many-core accelerated software package for processing time-domain radio-astronomy data, focusing on real-time processing of large datasets for transient detection.

tools.name: GaTector
tools.one_line_profile: Unified framework for gaze object prediction
tools.detailed_description: A framework for gaze object prediction that utilizes a specific-general-specific (SGS) feature extractor to handle scene and head images for gaze estimation and object detection.

tools.name: fink-mm
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-messenger astrophysics correlation for Fink broker
tools.detailed_description: A module for the Fink broker that correlates Fink alerts with the General Coordinates Network (GCN) to enable multi-messenger astrophysics analysis.

tools.name: GWAS_tools
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for processing GWAS summary statistics
tools.detailed_description: A shell-based pipeline for processing and quality controlling Genome-Wide Association Study (GWAS) summary statistic datasets.

tools.name: pymser
tools.one_line_profile: Marginal Standard Error Rule for transient regime detection in simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python library applying the Marginal Standard Error Rule (MSER) to detect and truncate transient regimes in Grand Canonical Monte Carlo adsorption simulations.

tools.name: gwIAS-HM
tools.one_line_profile: Gravitational wave search pipeline with higher harmonics
tools.detailed_description: A gravitational wave search pipeline that incorporates higher harmonics, developed by the IAS GW group.

tools.name: GWAS-pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: GWAS analysis pipeline from QC to summary statistics
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for Genome-Wide Association Studies covering steps from quality control to generating summary statistics.

tools.name: GWENA
tools.one_line_profile: Gene Co-expression Network Analysis pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for performing Gene Co-expression Network Analysis (GCNA), facilitating the construction and analysis of gene networks.

tools.name: ztf-alert-server
tools.one_line_profile: Alert repository server for ZTF alerts
tools.detailed_description: A server implementation for handling and storing alerts generated by the Zwicky Transient Facility (ZTF).

tools.name: mwa_trigger
tools.one_line_profile: VOEvent handling and triggering for MWA telescope
tools.detailed_description: A daemon and library for handling VOEvents and generating triggered observations for the Murchison Widefield Array (MWA) radio telescope.

tools.name: BnsLib
tools.one_line_profile: Library for binary neutron star GW data analysis
tools.detailed_description: A PyCBC-based library for working with binary neutron star or binary black hole gravitational wave data, specifically in the context of machine learning applications.

tools.name: Quinn2019_BurstHMM
tools.one_line_profile: Transient event detection using Hidden Markov Models
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Hidden Markov Models (HMM) for detecting transient burst events in time-series data, likely for neuroscience or similar signal processing applications.

tools.name: Water-Body-Detection-from-Satellite-Imagery
tools.one_line_profile: Water body detection using remote sensing indices
tools.detailed_description: A tool for detecting water bodies from satellite imagery using remote sensing techniques like NDWI, MNDWI, and supervised classification models.

tools.name: GWSpace
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-mission science data simulator for space-based gravitational wave detection
tools.detailed_description: A simulation tool designed for space-based gravitational wave detection missions (like TianQin), enabling the generation of simulated scientific data for mission planning and analysis.

tools.name: TransientViT
tools.one_line_profile: Real/bogus transient classifier using CNN-ViT hybrid model
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model combining CNN and Vision Transformers for classifying transient candidates (real vs bogus) in the Kilodegree Automatic Transient Survey (KATS).

tools.name: perl-modules-for-voevent
tools.one_line_profile: Perl modules for handling IVOA standard VOEvent messages
tools.detailed_description: A library for parsing and handling VOEvent messages, which are the standard for astronomical transient alerts in the Virtual Observatory infrastructure.

tools.name: ALeRCE Client
tools.one_line_profile: Python client for the ALeRCE astronomical broker
tools.detailed_description: A client library to interact with the ALeRCE (Automatic Learning for the Rapid Classification of Events) broker, facilitating access to astronomical alerts and light curves.

tools.name: Light Curve Classifier
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning classifier for astronomical light curves
tools.detailed_description: A component of the ALeRCE broker system designed to classify astronomical objects based on their light curves using machine learning techniques.

tools.name: ALeRCE Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Processing pipeline for the ALeRCE astronomical broker
tools.detailed_description: The core processing pipeline for the ALeRCE broker, handling the ingestion, processing, and classification of astronomical alert streams.

tools.name: ZTF Explorer
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for ZTF data via ALeRCE
tools.detailed_description: A web-based exploration tool for visualizing and analyzing ZTF (Zwicky Transient Facility) data provided by the ALeRCE broker.

tools.name: VAST Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Radio transient detection pipeline for the VAST project
tools.detailed_description: The data processing pipeline for the VAST (Variables and Slow Transients) survey on the ASKAP telescope, designed to detect radio transients.

tools.name: Fink Broker
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomy broker based on Apache Spark
tools.detailed_description: A scalable community broker for processing large streams of astronomical alerts (e.g., from ZTF, LSST) using Apache Spark, enabling real-time transient detection and classification.

tools.name: Fink Client
tools.one_line_profile: Client for manipulating Fink broker alerts
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight client library for users to interact with the Fink broker, query alerts, and retrieve data.

tools.name: Fink Science
tools.one_line_profile: Science modules for Fink broker alerts
tools.detailed_description: A collection of science modules and algorithms used within the Fink broker to add value to alerts, such as classification scores and cross-matching.

tools.name: Fink Science Portal
tools.one_line_profile: Web portal for exploring Fink broker data
tools.detailed_description: The web interface and backend for the Fink Science Portal, allowing users to visualize, search, and analyze astronomical alerts processed by Fink.

tools.name: Bilby
tools.one_line_profile: Unified framework for stochastic sampling and gravitational-wave inference
tools.detailed_description: A user-friendly Bayesian inference library for gravitational-wave astronomy, providing a unified interface to various stochastic samplers.

tools.name: AMPEL
tools.one_line_profile: Modular and scalable platform for analyzing streaming data
tools.detailed_description: The Amazing Multipurpose Policy Engine (AMPEL) is a software framework designed for the analysis of high-throughput heterogeneous data streams, widely used in astronomy for transient alert processing (e.g., ZTF, LSST).

tools.name: rtpipe
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time fast transient detection pipeline for radio interferometric data
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed for searching and detecting fast radio transients (like FRBs) in real-time using visibility data from radio interferometers such as the VLA.

tools.name: DASH
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning for automated spectral classification of supernovae
tools.detailed_description: Deep Automated Supernova Hostless (DASH) is a software package that automates the classification of supernova spectra using deep learning, capable of identifying type, age, and redshift.

tools.name: Dingo
tools.one_line_profile: Deep inference for gravitational-wave observations
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning library for performing rapid parameter estimation and inference on gravitational wave data, enabling fast analysis of compact binary coalescences.

tools.name: nf-gwas
tools.one_line_profile: Nextflow pipeline for genome-wide association studies (GWAS)
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Nextflow pipeline to perform state-of-the-art genome-wide association studies, including quality control, phasing, imputation, and association testing.

tools.name: gwin
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian inference package for gravitational-wave data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed for performing Bayesian inference on gravitational-wave data, facilitating parameter estimation and model selection.

tools.name: PyCBC
tools.one_line_profile: Core package for gravitational-wave data analysis and signal detection
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive software package used to analyze gravitational-wave data, detect signals (such as compact binary mergers), and infer their parameters. It is a standard tool in the LIGO/Virgo collaboration.

tools.name: SPANNER
tools.one_line_profile: Reconstruction algorithm for clinical photoacoustic imaging
tools.detailed_description: A robust algorithm called Superiorized Photo-Acoustic Non-NEgative Reconstruction (SPANNER) designed to reconstruct PA images in real-time, addressing limitations in viewing angles and imaging depth.

tools.name: bilby (Genomics)
tools.one_line_profile: Jax-based machine learning library for functional genomics
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning library implemented in Jax, specifically designed for functional genomics applications.

tools.name: IKMB GWAS Association
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for GWAS association testing
tools.detailed_description: The IKMB GWAS Association Testing Pipeline, designed to perform genome-wide association studies.

tools.name: IKMB GWAS QC
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for GWAS quality control
tools.detailed_description: The IKMB GWAS Quality Control Pipeline, providing automated quality control steps for genome-wide association study data.

tools.name: evo-mcts
tools.one_line_profile: Evolutionary Monte Carlo Tree Search for GW detection
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Automated Algorithmic Discovery for Gravitational-Wave Detection Guided by LLM-Informed Evolutionary Monte Carlo Tree Search.

tools.name: TrioGWAS
tools.one_line_profile: Automated pipeline for GWAS on trios
tools.detailed_description: An automated pipeline designed for performing Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) specifically on trio data (parents and offspring).

tools.name: SAR Change Detection
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning based change detection for SAR imagery
tools.detailed_description: Code for the paper 'Improved Difference Images for Change Detection Classifiers in SAR Imagery Using Deep Learning', implementing methods for analyzing Synthetic Aperture Radar images.

tools.name: Comet
tools.one_line_profile: VOEvent transport system for astronomical transients
tools.detailed_description: A complete VOEvent transport system designed to receive and distribute astronomical event notifications (transients).

tools.name: time_to_detection
tools.one_line_profile: Time-to-detection simulations for PTA Gravitational Waves
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts for performing time-to-detection simulations for Pulsar Timing Array (PTA) detection of Gravitational Waves.

tools.name: bacterialGWAS
tools.one_line_profile: GWAS pipeline for bacterial genomes
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for performing genome-wide association tests specifically tailored for bacterial genomes.

tools.name: SNEx2
tools.one_line_profile: Supernova Exchange built with TOM Toolkit
tools.detailed_description: The updated Supernova Exchange (SNEx), built with the TOM Toolkit and used by the Global Supernova Project collaboration for managing supernova observations.

tools.name: gwas_gemma
tools.one_line_profile: Simple pipeline for GWAS with GEMMA
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline to perform Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) using the GEMMA software.

tools.name: hdrvdp
tools.one_line_profile: Visible Difference Metric for HDR images
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of HDR-VDP (High Dynamic Range Visible Difference Predictor), a metric for predicting visible differences in high dynamic range images, used in visual perception and image science research.

tools.name: Repetitive-transient-impact-detector
tools.one_line_profile: Detector for repetitive transient impacts in bearing faults
tools.detailed_description: Code for the paper 'Repetitive transient impact detection and its application in cross-machine bearing fault detection', used for mechanical signal processing and fault diagnosis.

tools.name: stdpipe
tools.one_line_profile: Simple Transient Detection Pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A set of tools and routines for processing astronomical images and detecting transient objects.

tools.name: stdweb
tools.one_line_profile: Web interface for Simple Transient Detection Pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A web-based platform for the Simple Transient Detection Pipeline (stdpipe), allowing users to interact with transient detection workflows.

tools.name: Dedisp.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Brute-force dedispersion for radio transient detection
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for brute-force dedispersion, a key step in detecting radio transients (like FRBs or pulsars) in radio astronomy data.

tools.name: relativebilbying
tools.one_line_profile: Relative binning for Bilby GW inference
tools.detailed_description: Code to include relative binning techniques in the Bilby library for faster gravitational wave parameter estimation.

tools.name: Lifebit GWAS
tools.one_line_profile: GWAS pipeline using SAIGE
tools.detailed_description: A Genome-Wide Association Study (GWAS) pipeline implemented using SAIGE, designed for scalable analysis of genetic data.

tools.name: EdgRec
tools.one_line_profile: Surface anomaly detection via edge reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: Reconstruction from edge image combined with color and gradient difference for industrial surface anomaly detection.

tools.name: nrutils_dev
tools.one_line_profile: Python API for Numerical Relativity data analysis
tools.detailed_description: Python API for low-level analysis of Numerical Relativity (NR) data, including Psi4, strain, modeling, and interfaces to LAL/PyCBC.

tools.name: Lasair Project Management
tools.one_line_profile: Event handling platform for LSST:UK (Lasair)
tools.detailed_description: The event handling site and project management code for Lasair, the LSST:UK alert broker, used for processing and filtering astronomical transients.

tools.name: TOM (Toolkit for OOM)
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for Observable Operator Modeling
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for Observable Operator Models (OOMs), which are used for modeling stochastic processes and sequence data.

tools.name: witsGWAS
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for Human GWAS analysis
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for Human GWAS analysis that accommodates both Affymetrix (raw .CEL files) and Illumina (Plink binaries) data.

tools.name: TheFaultEngine
tools.one_line_profile: Engine for transient alarm detection and root cause analysis
tools.detailed_description: A fault analysis engine consisting of modules for transient alarm detection, root cause analysis, and correlated clusters, likely for industrial or systems engineering.

tools.name: ephemeris
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript library for calculating solar, planetary, and stellar ephemerides
tools.detailed_description: A pure JavaScript implementation for performing astronomical ephemeris calculations, including positions of the sun, planets, comets, asteroids, and stars, suitable for web-based astronomical applications.

tools.name: nessai
tools.one_line_profile: Nested Sampling with Artificial Intelligence for Bayesian inference
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that implements nested sampling algorithms accelerated by normalizing flows, designed for Bayesian inference tasks in physics and astronomy, particularly for gravitational wave data analysis.

tools.name: nf-gwas-pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Nextflow pipeline for Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS)
tools.detailed_description: A bioinformatics pipeline built with Nextflow for performing Genome-Wide Association Studies, automating the workflow from data processing to association analysis.

tools.name: pygcn
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for processing NASA GCN notices
tools.detailed_description: A Python library provided by NASA-GCN for parsing and processing Gamma-ray Coordinates Network (GCN) notices, enabling automated handling of astronomical alerts.

tools.name: nf-core/gwas
tools.one_line_profile: Portable pipeline for Genome-Wide Association Studies using Nextflow
tools.detailed_description: A community-curated Nextflow pipeline for performing Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS), ensuring reproducibility and portability across different computing environments.

tools.name: antaresEditObject
tools.one_line_profile: R package to edit Antares Simulator study parameters
tools.detailed_description: An R package developed by RTE for editing the input data and parameters of Antares Simulator studies, facilitating the configuration of large-scale power system simulations.

tools.name: antaresProcessing
tools.one_line_profile: R package for processing Antares Simulator output data
tools.detailed_description: An R package for processing and aggregating the output data from Antares Simulator, enabling efficient analysis of power system simulation results.

tools.name: antaresRead
tools.one_line_profile: R package to import and explore Antares Simulator results
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to import, manipulate, and explore simulation results generated by the Antares Simulator, serving as a bridge between the simulator and R's data analysis ecosystem.

tools.name: antaresViz
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization package for Antares Simulator data
tools.detailed_description: An R package for generating interactive visualizations of data from Antares Simulator studies, helping researchers and engineers analyze power system dynamics.

tools.name: DIA
tools.one_line_profile: Difference Image Analysis for Wide-Field Surveys
tools.detailed_description: A C implementation of Difference Image Analysis (DIA) algorithms, designed for detecting transient astronomical events in wide-field survey data by subtracting reference images from new observations.

tools.name: Kowalski
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-survey data archive and alert broker for time-domain astronomy
tools.detailed_description: Kowalski is a system for archiving and accessing astronomical data from multiple surveys, specifically designed to handle the high-volume data streams and alert brokering required for time-domain astronomy.

tools.name: Sherlock
tools.one_line_profile: The QUB Transient Classifier for astronomical sources
tools.detailed_description: Sherlock is a transient classifier package designed to cross-match and classify astronomical transients against a massive library of historical catalogs, aiding in the rapid identification of new sources.

tools.name: SFFT
tools.one_line_profile: Saccadic Fast Fourier Transform algorithm for image subtraction
tools.detailed_description: SFFT (Saccadic Fast Fourier Transform) is an algorithm and python tool for efficient image subtraction in Fourier space, a critical step in detecting transient astronomical events by comparing new observations with reference images.

tools.name: ggwd
tools.one_line_profile: Generator for synthetic gravitational-wave data
tools.detailed_description: ggwd is a tool that utilizes PyCBC and LALSuite to generate synthetic gravitational-wave data, facilitating the training and testing of machine learning models for gravitational wave detection.

tools.name: voevent-parse
tools.one_line_profile: Library for parsing and manipulating VOEvent packets
tools.detailed_description: voevent-parse is a Python library built on lxml.objectify for parsing, manipulating, and creating VOEvent packets, which are the standard format for reporting astronomical transient events.

tools.name: Multi-SConES
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-task feature selection for selecting connected explanatory SNPs in GWAS
tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing Multi-SConES, a method for multi-task feature selection coupled with multiple network regularizers, primarily used in bioinformatics for Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) to identify significant SNPs.

tools.name: RESSPECT
tools.one_line_profile: Recommendation system for telescope resource allocation in supernova cosmology
tools.detailed_description: A Python package developed by the Cosmostatistics Initiative (COIN) and LSST DESC to optimize photometric supernova cosmology analysis through an active learning-based recommendation system for telescope resource allocation.

tools.name: SCONE
tools.one_line_profile: Stochastic Calculator Of Neutron transport Equation
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran-based stochastic calculator for solving the neutron transport equation, used in nuclear physics and engineering for simulating neutron behavior.

tools.name: HOPS
tools.one_line_profile: Software for single-object photometry and exoplanet light-curve modelling
tools.detailed_description: A user-friendly software package designed for analyzing astronomical data, specifically for single-object photometry and modelling the light curves of exoplanets.

tools.name: MUTIS
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis of correlations of light curves and their statistical significance
tools.detailed_description: A Python package from IAA-CSIC for analyzing correlations in astronomical light curves and determining their statistical significance, useful for multi-wavelength studies.

tools.name: pyzdcf
tools.one_line_profile: Estimation of cross-correlation function of astronomical time-series using ZDCF
tools.detailed_description: A Python module for estimating the cross-correlation function of sparse, unevenly sampled astronomical time-series data based on the Z-Transformed Discrete Correlation Function (ZDCF) method.

tools.name: elasticc
tools.one_line_profile: Infrastructure and metrics for the ELAsTiCC astronomical classification challenge
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing settings, configuration, and metric implementations for the Extended LSST Astronomical Time Series Classification Challenge (ELAsTiCC), used for evaluating transient classifiers.

tools.name: parsnip
tools.one_line_profile: Deep generative modeling of astronomical transient light curves
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for deep generative modeling of astronomical transient light curves. It learns a low-dimensional representation of transients that can be used for classification, augmentation, and other analysis tasks.

tools.name: plasticc-kit
tools.one_line_profile: Starter Kit for the Photometric LSST Astronomical Time-series Classification Challenge
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit providing data loaders, metrics, and example notebooks for the Photometric LSST Astronomical Time-series Classification Challenge (PLAsTiCC), facilitating the development of classification models for astronomical transients.

tools.name: snmachine
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning code for photometric supernova classification
tools.detailed_description: A Python library developed by LSST DESC for photometric supernova classification using various machine learning techniques, designed to process light curves and extract features for classification.

tools.name: Spacetimeformer
tools.one_line_profile: Long-Range Transformers for Dynamic Spatiotemporal Forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A multivariate time series forecasting framework using efficient Transformers, specifically designed to learn long-range dependencies in spatiotemporal data. While general-purpose, it is highly relevant for scientific modeling tasks involving space and time dynamics.

tools.name: VegasAfterglow
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance C++ framework for GRB afterglow modeling
tools.detailed_description: A C++ framework with Python bindings for modeling Gamma-Ray Burst (GRB) afterglows. It features fast multi-wavelength light curve generation, MCMC parameter inference, and advanced physics models including shock dynamics and structured jets.

tools.name: SCoPe-ML
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning classification pipeline for ZTF sources
tools.detailed_description: The SCoPe (ZTF Source Classification Project) repository contains the machine learning pipeline used for classifying astronomical sources detected by the Zwicky Transient Facility (ZTF).

tools.name: ATAT
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical Transformer for Time Series and Tabular Data
tools.detailed_description: ATAT is a Transformer-based model designed for processing astronomical time series and tabular data, developed as part of the ALeRCE broker ecosystem for classification and analysis tasks.

tools.name: LC Classifier
tools.one_line_profile: Light Curve Classifier for the ALeRCE Broker
tools.detailed_description: The Light Curve Classifier used by the ALeRCE broker system to classify astronomical alerts based on their photometric time-series data. It includes feature extraction and machine learning classification models.

tools.name: mind_the_gaps
tools.one_line_profile: Gaussian Process analysis tool for irregularly-sampled astronomical time series
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for performing Gaussian Process time series analysis, specifically focused on period detection in irregularly-sampled and stochastically-varying astronomical light curves.

tools.name: gatspy
tools.one_line_profile: General tools for astronomical time series analysis
tools.detailed_description: A library for astronomical time series analysis in Python, providing tools for periodogram analysis (Lomb-Scargle, Supersmoother) and Gaussian Process modeling of light curves.

tools.name: keplersplinev2
tools.one_line_profile: Robust B-spline fitting tool for astronomical light curves
tools.detailed_description: A Python code for robustly fitting a basis spline to data, particularly useful for detrending and analyzing astronomical light curves (e.g., Kepler/K2 data).

tools.name: deepSIP
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning tool for Supernova Ia parameter estimation
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning framework for estimating parameters of Type Ia Supernovae from optical spectra and light curves.

tools.name: Avocado (Genomics)
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed variant caller for genomics
tools.detailed_description: A distributed variant caller built on top of the ADAM genomics processing engine, designed for calling variants from high-throughput sequencing data.

tools.name: Icarus
tools.one_line_profile: Stellar binary light curve synthesis tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for synthesizing light curves of stellar binary systems, used for modeling and analyzing binary star data.

tools.name: Astro R-CNN
tools.one_line_profile: Instance segmentation for astronomical images using Mask R-CNN
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of Mask R-CNN adapted for instance segmentation and detection of sources in astronomical images.

tools.name: Deep-LC
tools.one_line_profile: General astrophysical light curve classification package
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed for the classification of general astrophysical light curves using deep learning techniques.

tools.name: astrodash
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning for automated spectral classification of supernovae
tools.detailed_description: DASH (Deep Automated Supernova cHaracterization) is a deep learning software for the automated spectral classification of supernovae.

tools.name: SCONES
tools.one_line_profile: Self-Consistent Neural Network for Protein Stability Prediction
tools.detailed_description: A neural network based tool for predicting protein stability changes upon mutations, utilizing a self-consistent representation of the protein environment.

tools.name: AVOCADO
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive Optimal Collision Avoidance driven by Opinion
tools.detailed_description: A robotics navigation framework implementing an adaptive optimal collision avoidance algorithm driven by opinion dynamics, as presented in IEEE Transactions on Robotics.

tools.name: braai
tools.one_line_profile: Real-bogus astrophysical event classification for ZTF
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning based tool for separating real astrophysical events from bogus detections (artifacts) in Zwicky Transient Facility (ZTF) data.

tools.name: tails
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning based comet detection for ZTF
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning pipeline designed to identify and chase comets within the Zwicky Transient Facility (ZTF) data stream.

tools.name: lightcurver
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for light curve extraction from astronomical images
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed for the precise extraction of light curves through forward modelling of regions from time-series wide-field astronomical images.

tools.name: upsilon
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Classification of Periodic Variable Stars
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning library for the automated classification of periodic variable stars using light curve features.

tools.name: AltaiPony
tools.one_line_profile: Flare finding in Kepler and TESS light curves
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for de-trending light curves and finding stellar flares in Kepler, K2, and TESS mission data.

tools.name: jaxoplanet
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical time series analysis with JAX
tools.detailed_description: A library for probabilistic inference and analysis of astronomical time series (specifically exoplanets) built on top of JAX.

tools.name: kantime
tools.one_line_profile: R bindings for NeuralForecast KAN models
tools.detailed_description: Provides R bindings for Nixtla's neuralforecast library, specifically enabling the use of Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (KANs) for time series forecasting within the R ecosystem.

tools.name: cosmogrb
tools.one_line_profile: Cosmological GRB light curve simulator
tools.detailed_description: A simulator for generating synthetic light curves of Gamma-Ray Bursts (GRBs) in a cosmological context, useful for testing analysis pipelines.

tools.name: lightcurve_fitting
tools.one_line_profile: Tools to fit analytical models to multiband light curves
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for fitting analytical models to multiband light curves of astronomical transients, supporting parameter estimation.

tools.name: grtrace
tools.one_line_profile: General Relativity Raytracer
tools.detailed_description: A raytracing tool that simulates light bending in curved spacetimes, allowing for visualization and analysis of general relativity effects.

tools.name: magic-microlensing
tools.one_line_profile: Microlensing Analysis Guided by Intelligent Computation
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based framework for the automatic analysis and modeling of realistic microlensing light curves using neural networks.

tools.name: astroNN
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Learning for Astronomers with Keras
tools.detailed_description: A python package containing deep learning tools and models specifically designed for astronomical applications, including spectroscopy and photometry analysis.

tools.name: PyTransit
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and easy exoplanet transit light curve modelling
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for creating exoplanet transit light curves, offering optimized performance for modelling and analysis of photometric data.

tools.name: Fulu
tools.one_line_profile: Supernova light curve approximation library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing machine learning-based methods for approximating and augmenting supernova light curves, useful for handling sparse astronomical time-series data.

tools.name: Avocado (Epigenomics)
tools.one_line_profile: Deep tensor factorization for epigenome imputation
tools.detailed_description: A multi-scale deep tensor factorization model that learns latent representations of the human epigenome to impute missing experiments and analyze epigenomic data.

tools.name: VARTOOLS
tools.one_line_profile: Command line tool for astronomical time series analysis
tools.detailed_description: A program for processing and analyzing astronomical time series data, providing tools for period search, light curve manipulation, and statistics.

tools.name: FATS-2.0
tools.one_line_profile: Feature Analysis for Time Series in Astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for extracting features from astronomical light curves to facilitate machine learning classification and variability analysis.

tools.name: xSAGA
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning extension for SAGA galaxy survey
tools.detailed_description: A tool extending the SAGA survey to wide-field regimes using deep learning to identify satellite galaxies around Milky Way analogs.

tools.name: Avocado (Astronomy)
tools.one_line_profile: Photometric classification of astronomical transients
tools.detailed_description: A package for the photometric classification of astronomical transients and variables, featuring data augmentation techniques (Gaussian Process) to handle biased spectroscopic samples.

tools.name: Pyriod
tools.one_line_profile: Period detection and fitting for astronomical time series
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for identifying periods in astronomical time series data and fitting models to the variability.

tools.name: light-curve
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance time-series feature extraction in Rust
tools.detailed_description: A Rust library for fast and efficient feature extraction from time-series data, specifically designed for astronomical light curves.

tools.name: light-curve-python
tools.one_line_profile: Python bindings for light-curve feature extraction
tools.detailed_description: Python bindings for the 'light-curve' Rust library, enabling fast feature extraction from astronomical light curves within Python workflows.

tools.name: batman
tools.one_line_profile: Fast transit light curve models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for the calculation of exoplanet transit light curves, known for its speed and flexibility in modelling transit events.

tools.name: LLCaps
tools.one_line_profile: Low-light enhancement for capsule endoscopy
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model for illuminating low-light capsule endoscopy images using curved wavelet attention and reverse diffusion.

tools.name: lightcurves
tools.one_line_profile: R code for light curve analysis
tools.detailed_description: A collection of R scripts and functions for analyzing light curves, including classification, noisification, and outlier detection.

tools.name: LightCurvesClassifier
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning classifier for astronomical light curves
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed for the machine learning-based classification of astronomical objects using their light curve data.

tools.name: ELISa
tools.one_line_profile: Eclipsing binary Learning and Interactive System
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool for efficient modeling of light and radial velocity curves of eclipsing binaries, including optimization methods like MCMC.

tools.name: MiraPy
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Learning library for Astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A Python package facilitating the application of deep learning techniques to astronomical data, including light curves and images.

tools.name: AnomalyALeRCE
tools.one_line_profile: Anomaly Detector for ALeRCE broker
tools.detailed_description: A tool for detecting anomalies in astronomical data streams processed by the ALeRCE broker.

tools.name: BTSbot
tools.one_line_profile: Automated supernova identification bot
tools.detailed_description: A multi-modal deep learning system for the automated identification and classification of supernovae from survey data.

tools.name: ExoMiner
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning for exoplanet validation
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning-based tool for automating the vetting and validation of exoplanet candidates from Kepler and TESS photometry missions.

tools.name: ellc
tools.one_line_profile: Light curve model for transiting exoplanets and eclipsing binary stars
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran/Python tool for modeling light curves of transiting exoplanets and eclipsing binary stars, capable of handling various stellar shapes and limb darkening profiles.

tools.name: pycheops
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis tool for light curves from the ESA Cheops mission
tools.detailed_description: A Python module specifically designed for the analysis of light curve data from the ESA Cheops mission, including detrending and transit fitting capabilities.

tools.name: deepCR
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Learning based cosmic ray removal for astronomical images
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning tool for identifying and removing cosmic rays from astronomical images, offering rapid processing compared to traditional methods.

tools.name: planetplanet
tools.one_line_profile: General photodynamical code for exoplanet light curves
tools.detailed_description: A general photodynamical code designed to model exoplanet light curves, handling planet-planet interactions and other dynamical effects.

tools.name: lcviz
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive light curve visualization tool for Jdaviz
tools.detailed_description: A visualization tool built on the Jdaviz framework, designed specifically for viewing and analyzing astronomical light curves, supported by STScI.

tools.name: SuperNNova
tools.one_line_profile: Photometric classification of supernovae using Deep Learning
tools.detailed_description: An open-source framework for photometric classification of supernovae using deep learning techniques (RNNs, Bayesian NNs, CNNs), designed for large-scale surveys.

tools.name: SCONE Core
tools.one_line_profile: Open source software for predictive simulation of biological motion
tools.detailed_description: SCONE is a software framework for performing predictive simulations of human and animal motion. It is designed to optimize neuromuscular controllers for musculoskeletal models.

tools.name: SCONE Studio
tools.one_line_profile: Graphical User Interface for the SCONE simulation framework
tools.detailed_description: SCONE Studio provides a GUI for setting up, running, and analyzing predictive simulations of biological motion using the SCONE core library.

tools.name: Sconegym
tools.one_line_profile: OpenAI Gym environments for SCONE biomechanics simulations
tools.detailed_description: Provides Reinforcement Learning environments for musculoskeletal simulations, bridging the SCONE simulator with standard RL algorithms.

tools.name: Time-Series-Library
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive library for advanced deep time series analysis models
tools.detailed_description: A state-of-the-art library containing implementations of various deep learning models (Transformers, MLP, CNNs) for time series forecasting, classification, anomaly detection, and imputation.

tools.name: baguette
tools.one_line_profile: Parsnip model wrappers for bagging ensembles
tools.detailed_description: Part of the tidymodels ecosystem, providing efficient implementations for bagging (bootstrap aggregating) models, including trees and MARS.

tools.name: bonsai
tools.one_line_profile: Parsnip wrappers for advanced tree-based models
tools.detailed_description: An extension to the parsnip package in R, providing bindings for LightGBM and Partykit tree models for statistical learning.

tools.name: censored
tools.one_line_profile: Parsnip engines for survival analysis models
tools.detailed_description: Provides a unified interface for survival analysis models within the tidymodels framework, enabling time-to-event prediction.

tools.name: discrim
tools.one_line_profile: Parsnip wrappers for discriminant analysis models
tools.detailed_description: Enables discriminant analysis and Naive Bayes models within the tidymodels ecosystem for classification tasks.

tools.name: multilevelmod
tools.one_line_profile: Parsnip bindings for multilevel and hierarchical models
tools.detailed_description: Provides an interface for fitting mixed-effects and hierarchical models (e.g., lme4, nlme) using the parsnip syntax.

tools.name: poissonreg
tools.one_line_profile: Parsnip wrappers for Poisson regression models
tools.detailed_description: Extensions for parsnip to handle Poisson regression and other count data models.

tools.name: rules
tools.one_line_profile: Parsnip bindings for rule-based models
tools.detailed_description: Provides infrastructure for rule-based classification and regression models (like C5.0 and Cubist) within tidymodels.

tools.name: pylightcurve
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for modeling and analyzing transit light-curves
tools.detailed_description: A tool for modeling exoplanet transits and analyzing their light curves, including limb darkening and orbit calculation.

tools.name: VBBinaryLensing
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for microlensing light curve calculation
tools.detailed_description: A code for computing magnification of gravitational microlensing events caused by binary lens systems, using the VBB (Valerio Bozza Binary) method.

tools.name: fastdup
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for insights, quality control, and deduplication of image/video datasets
tools.detailed_description: A scalable tool for analyzing large visual datasets to identify duplicates, anomalies, and quality issues, essential for curating scientific image datasets (e.g., in astronomy or biology).

tools.name: astrobase
tools.one_line_profile: Python modules for light curve work and variable star astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python modules for analyzing light curves, performing period finding, and other tasks related to variable star astronomy.

tools.name: Astronet-Triage
tools.one_line_profile: Neural Network for TESS Light Curve Triage
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model and tool designed to triage light curves from the TESS mission, identifying potential transit candidates.

tools.name: TOM Toolkit Base
tools.one_line_profile: Base framework for building Target and Observation Managers (TOMs) in astronomy
tools.detailed_description: The TOM Toolkit is a framework designed to help astronomers build Target and Observation Managers (TOMs). It provides a standardized interface for managing astronomical targets, planning observations, and interfacing with various observatories and data archives.

tools.name: simsurvey
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation package for astronomical survey cadence and strategy evaluation
tools.detailed_description: Simsurvey is a python package for simulating light curves of transient events (like supernovae) based on a survey strategy (cadence, depth, etc.). It helps astronomers evaluate the efficiency of different observing strategies for detecting specific types of transients.

tools.name: ztf_sim
tools.one_line_profile: Scheduler and simulation tools for the Zwicky Transient Facility (ZTF)
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains the scheduling algorithms and simulation tools used for the Zwicky Transient Facility (ZTF). It allows for the planning of survey observations and the simulation of survey performance.

tools.name: QUBO-Chimera
tools.one_line_profile: Software solver for D-Wave's native QUBO problems on Chimera graph topologies
tools.detailed_description: A testbed and solver to evaluate how effectively D-Wave's native Quadratic Unconstrained Binary Optimization (QUBO) problems can be solved in software, specifically targeting the Chimera graph topology used in quantum annealers.

tools.name: MATRIX
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed data-aware execution fabric for high-performance scientific computing
tools.detailed_description: MATRIX is a distributed data-aware execution fabric supporting both high-performance computing (HPC) and many-task computing (MTC) workloads. It is designed to handle scientific workflows in fields like bioinformatics and astronomy by optimizing data locality and task scheduling.

tools.name: tilepy
tools.one_line_profile: Observation scheduling tool for tiling poorly localized transient events
tools.detailed_description: Tilepy is a tool designed for observation scheduling in poorly localized events, such as gravitational wave follow-ups. It helps determine the optimal tiling strategy to cover the probability map of the event.

tools.name: astroplan
tools.one_line_profile: Observation planning and scheduling library for astronomers
tools.detailed_description: Astroplan is an open source Python package to help astronomers plan observations. It provides tools for calculating rise/set times, moon phases, and creating observing schedules for targets at specific observatories.

tools.name: Chimera
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed observatory automation and control system
tools.detailed_description: Chimera is an observatory automation system that provides a distributed framework for controlling telescopes, cameras, and other astronomical instruments. It enables remote operation and automated observation scripts.

tools.name: ZetaPersei
tools.one_line_profile: Observation planning tools for Keck NIRC2 Polarimetry Mode
tools.detailed_description: Software tools designed for science and calibration observation planning specifically for the NIRC2 Polarimetry Mode at the Keck Observatory.

tools.name: obsplan
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for astronomical observation planning and scheduling
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to assist in the planning of astronomical observations, likely providing utilities for visibility calculation, scheduling, and constraint checking.

tools.name: Tapir
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for planning astronomical observations including transit visibility and airmass plots
tools.detailed_description: A set of tools designed to aid astronomers in planning observations, featuring capabilities for calculating transit visibility, generating airmass plots, and creating finding charts.

tools.name: RemoteObservatory
tools.one_line_profile: Control system for astronomical observatories
tools.detailed_description: A software system designed to control astronomical observatory hardware, facilitating remote operation and potentially automated observation scheduling.

tools.name: Sauron
tools.one_line_profile: Robotic observatory system for converting devices into automated telescopes
tools.detailed_description: An open source project aimed at converting phones, cameras, or telescopes into robotic observatory systems, enabling automated data acquisition for astronomy.

tools.name: obsy
tools.one_line_profile: Open Observatory Management System
tools.detailed_description: A management system for astronomical observatories, likely handling tasks such as equipment control, environmental monitoring, and observation scheduling.

tools.name: icare
tools.one_line_profile: Custom frontend and backend layer for SkyPortal for the Grandma collaboration
tools.detailed_description: A customized extension of the SkyPortal platform, providing specific features for the Grandma collaboration to manage astronomical transients and coordinate follow-up observations.

tools.name: growth-too-marshal
tools.one_line_profile: Target of Opportunity Marshal for the GROWTH collaboration
tools.detailed_description: A web-based portal (Marshal) used by the GROWTH collaboration to manage Target of Opportunity (ToO) triggers, filter transient candidates, and schedule follow-up observations.

tools.name: Tomographic-Reconstruction
tools.one_line_profile: Computed Tomography (CT) Reconstruction toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for Computed Tomography (CT) reconstruction, implementing algorithms such as Radon transforms, filtered back projection, and Fourier methods for scientific imaging.

tools.name: OCS
tools.one_line_profile: Observatory Control System
tools.detailed_description: Software for controlling astronomical observatory equipment, likely including telescope mounts and cameras.

tools.name: ObservationTools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for planning astronomical observations
tools.detailed_description: A collection of utilities to assist in the planning of astronomical observations, likely including visibility checks and coordinate calculations.

tools.name: pychimera
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for UCSF Chimera molecular visualization system
tools.detailed_description: A tool that enables the use of the UCSF Chimera Python API within a standard Python interpreter, facilitating automation and scripting for molecular modeling and visualization.

tools.name: asterope-scala-legacy
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomy charting and observation planning application
tools.detailed_description: Legacy Scala codebase for Asterope, an application for astronomy charting, observation planning, ephemeris calculation, and image processing.

tools.name: AstroMosaic
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based telescope planner for mosaic observations
tools.detailed_description: A web tool for visually planning astronomical observations, specifically designed for calculating coordinates for mosaic imaging.

tools.name: snex2
tools.one_line_profile: Updated Supernova Exchange built with TOM Toolkit
tools.detailed_description: The Supernova Exchange platform, built using the TOM (Target and Observation Manager) Toolkit, used by the Global Supernova Project for managing supernova data and observations.

tools.name: GotoPiScope
tools.one_line_profile: Raspberry Pi-based telescope control system
tools.detailed_description: An advanced telescope control system running on Raspberry Pi, designed to automate astronomical observations and provide precision control.

tools.name: legacy_sims_featureScheduler
tools.one_line_profile: Telescope scheduler optimizing observing strategy using basis functions
tools.detailed_description: A telescope scheduling tool developed for LSST simulations that uses basis functions computed from features to optimize observing strategies.

tools.name: rubin_sim
tools.one_line_profile: Scheduler and survey strategy simulation tools for Rubin Observatory
tools.detailed_description: A set of tools for the Rubin Observatory to simulate the scheduler, analyze survey strategies, and perform other related simulations to optimize observation plans.

tools.name: m4opt
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-Mission Multi-Messenger Observation Planning Toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit designed for planning observations across multiple missions and messengers, facilitating the scheduling of astronomical observations.

tools.name: tom
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for Observable Operator Modeling
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for learning and using Observable Operator Models (OOMs), which are used for modeling stochastic processes.

tools.name: AGFusion
tools.one_line_profile: Gene fusion annotation and visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python package used to annotate and visualize gene fusions, providing insights into the protein domains and functional consequences of fusion events.

tools.name: SPOT
tools.one_line_profile: Site Planning and Observation Tool for NAOJ
tools.detailed_description: A software tool used for site planning and observation scheduling, specifically developed for the National Astronomical Observatory of Japan (NAOJ).

tools.name: OpenSPIFe
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated planning and scheduling toolkit for space exploration
tools.detailed_description: The Open Scheduling and Planning Interface for Exploration (OpenSPIFe) is a toolkit developed by NASA for planning and scheduling space exploration missions.

tools.name: dorado-scheduling
tools.one_line_profile: Observation planning and scheduling simulations for Dorado
tools.detailed_description: Simulation tools for observation planning and scheduling for the Dorado mission. Note: Replaced by m4opt but remains a valid historical tool.

tools.name: yacrd
tools.one_line_profile: Chimeric read detector for long-read sequencing
tools.detailed_description: A tool for detecting chimeric reads in long-read sequencing data (PacBio, Nanopore), performing quality control and filtering.

tools.name: ChiDG
tools.one_line_profile: Chimera-based discontinuous Galerkin solver
tools.detailed_description: A discontinuous Galerkin solver built on the Chimera grid scheme, likely used for computational fluid dynamics (CFD) or similar physics simulations.

tools.name: adaptive_scheduler
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive scheduling software for astronomical observations
tools.detailed_description: A scheduling component for the Observatory Control System (OCS), designed to adaptively schedule astronomical observations.

tools.name: Cassiopee
tools.one_line_profile: CFD pre- and post-processing modules
tools.detailed_description: A set of Python modules for pre- and post-processing in Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD), handling mesh manipulation and solution analysis.

tools.name: POCS
tools.one_line_profile: PANOPTES Observatory Control System
tools.detailed_description: The Observatory Control System for the PANOPTES citizen-science project, designed to automate the finding of transiting exoplanets.

tools.name: obsplanning
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for planning astronomical observations
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing tools to assist in the planning of astronomical observations.

tools.name: observing-suite
tools.one_line_profile: Suite for planning and carrying out astronomical observations
tools.detailed_description: A suite of tools built on astropy and inspired by astroplan for planning and executing astronomical observations.

tools.name: SkyPortal
tools.one_line_profile: Collaborative platform for time-domain astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A web-based platform for managing, visualizing, and collaborating on time-domain astronomy data, including transient detection and follow-up.

tools.name: EOSSP
tools.one_line_profile: Earth Observation Satellite Scheduling Problem solver
tools.detailed_description: A planning software for the Earth Observation Satellite Scheduling Problem (EOSSP), developed as part of a PhD thesis.

tools.name: chimeraviz
tools.one_line_profile: R package for visualizing chimeric RNA fusions
tools.detailed_description: chimeraviz is an R package designed to automate the creation of visualizations for chimeric RNA, aiding in the analysis of gene fusions and RNA-sequencing data. It supports importing data from various fusion-finder tools and creating circle plots, cytoband plots, and other visualizations.

tools.name: VSEARCH
tools.one_line_profile: High-throughput sequence analysis tool for microbiome data
tools.detailed_description: VSEARCH is a versatile open-source tool for processing metagenomic and microbiome data. It performs tasks such as sequence alignment, clustering, chimera detection, dereplication, and taxonomy assignment, designed as a free, open-source alternative to USEARCH.

tools.name: ActSNClass
tools.one_line_profile: Active learning framework for photometric supernova classification
tools.detailed_description: A tool implementing active learning strategies specifically for the classification of supernova photometric light curves, aiming to optimize training data selection.

tools.name: xkn
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for computing kilonova light curves
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework dedicated to the computation and modeling of light curves associated with kilonova events.

tools.name: wise_light_curves
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to download and explore WISE mission light curves
tools.detailed_description: A Python package facilitating the retrieval and exploration of light curve data from the WISE (Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer) mission.

tools.name: dia_pipe
tools.one_line_profile: Difference Image Analysis pipeline for LSST DESC
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for Difference Image Analysis (DIA) built upon the LSST DM Science Pipelines, developed for the Dark Energy Science Collaboration (DESC) data challenges.

tools.name: MultimodalUniverse
tools.one_line_profile: Large-Scale Multimodal Dataset of Astronomical Data
tools.detailed_description: A large-scale multimodal dataset designed for astronomical research, facilitating the development of machine learning models for astronomy.

tools.name: SARS-CoV2-mRNA-Assemblies
tools.one_line_profile: Assemblies of putative SARS-CoV2 spike-encoding mRNA sequences
tools.detailed_description: A dataset providing experimental sequence information and assemblies for the RNA components of COVID-19 vaccines (Moderna and Pfizer/BioNTech).

tools.name: TSB-UAD
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-end benchmark suite for univariate time-series anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark suite for evaluating time-series anomaly detection algorithms, featuring datasets from multiple domains including space science (NASA) and providing a unified interface for model comparison.

tools.name: Avocado
tools.one_line_profile: Photometric classification of astronomical transients and variables
tools.detailed_description: A package for photometric classification of astronomical transients and variables, particularly designed for handling biased spectroscopic samples and data augmentation.

tools.name: sncosmo
tools.one_line_profile: Library for supernova cosmology analysis and modeling
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for supernova cosmology, providing tools for light curve simulation, fitting, and cosmological parameter estimation.
